available.name: available
available.comment:
Returns true if the API is available. The common causes of an API not being avilable are:

  • a permission is missing in the application's manifest.json file
  • the API is defined on a newer version of Chrome then the current runtime

onCreated.name: onCreated
onCreated.comment: Fired each time a process is created, providing the corrseponding Process object.

onExited.name: onExited
onExited.comment: Fired each time a process is terminated, providing the type of exit.

onUnresponsive.name: onUnresponsive
onUnresponsive.comment: Fired each time a process becomes unresponsive, providing the corrseponding Process object.

onUpdated.name: onUpdated
onUpdated.comment: Fired each time the Task Manager updates its process statistics, providing the dictionary of updated Process objects, indexed by process ID.

onUpdatedWithMemory.name: onUpdatedWithMemory
onUpdatedWithMemory.comment: Fired each time the Task Manager updates its process statistics, providing the dictionary of updated Process objects, indexed by process ID. Identical to onUpdate, with the addition of memory usage details included in each Process object. Note, collecting memory usage information incurs extra CPU usage and should only be listened for when needed.

getProcessIdForTab.name: getProcessIdForTab
getProcessIdForTab.comment:
Returns the ID of the renderer process for the specified tab.

chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeProcesses.getProcessIdForTab.tabId The ID of the tab for which the renderer process ID is to be returned.

Returns: Process ID of the tab's renderer process.

getProcessInfo.name: getProcessInfo
getProcessInfo.comment:
Retrieves the process information for each process ID specified.

chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeProcesses.getProcessInfo.processIds The list of process IDs or single process ID for which to return the process information. An empty list indicates all processes are requested.

chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeProcesses.getProcessInfo.includeMemory True if detailed memory usage is required. Note, collecting memory usage information incurs extra CPU usage and should only be queried for when needed.

Returns: A dictionary of Process objects for each requested process that is a live child process of the current browser process, indexed by process ID. Metrics requiring aggregation over time will not be populated in each Process object.

terminate.name: terminate
terminate.comment:
Terminates the specified renderer process. Equivalent to visiting about:crash, but without changing the tab's URL.

chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeProcesses.terminate.processId The ID of the process to be terminated.

Returns: True if terminating the process was successful, otherwise false.

available.name: available
available.comment:
Returns true if the API is available. The common causes of an API not being avilable are:

  • a permission is missing in the application's manifest.json file
  • the API is defined on a newer version of Chrome then the current runtime

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeProcesses.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeProcesses.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeProcesses.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeProcesses.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeProcesses.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeProcesses.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeProcesses.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
